steps.description:
# Welcome!

This is a [CodeTour](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vsls-contrib.codetour) that walks you through a codebase.

Thanks to Coder, you're already set up with this project and ready to start developing. Go to the next step for more details.

# IDE settings

This project has some IDE settings so that everyone is on the same page. However, you can set some personal settings too. To start, let's go into dark mode. Tap the command below:

>> echo "{ \"workbench.colorTheme\": \"Default Dark+\" }" > ~/.local/share/code-server/User/settings.json

Your IDE settings can also be managed in the Ui, just like VS Code: *File -> Preferences -> Settings*

# Fork the project

If you don't work for Coder, you'll want to fork the cdr/docs repository so you can commit changes. This image includes the `gh` CLI, so you can do this right from VS Code.

1) Log in
>> gh auth login

2) Fork this repo (it will add as a remote)
>> gh repo fork

That's it, check out the next step for our contributing docs

# Contributing

Read above for instructions on how to contribute. Once you're ready, you can submit a pull request with the `gh` CLI or on [the Github.com repo](https://github.com.cdr/docs).
